title: "Wait this actually works?" The game!

This actually works? ... {{item:3078}} {{item:3022}} {{champion:157}}

i come from the future. 
the land is full of hope again. your worries will soon be forgotten.

{{item:3009}}  {{item:3116}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3089}} 

wasn't even _that_ bad.

God damn it was ages ago when I played AP Varus (or Varus in general) the last time...

Well first of all you obviously need a pair of boots. Wether you take {{item:3006}}  or {{item:3020}}  or even {{item:3158}}  I can't tell for sure, I guess it depends from the rest of your built.

{{item:3085}}  _was_ a great item for AP-Onhit mages _unfortunatly_ it's AS got nerfed for a little bit of crit, that you don't really need. But I guess it's still a must-have with {{champion:110}} .

{{item:3040}}  for the mana is comprehensible and I don't really want to say something wrong because I have no current experience with AP-Varus or other AP-AS champs _but_ I'd consider buying a standard {{item:3165}}  as mage instead: It gives you a good amount of mana supply, fills your remaining CDR and the AP amount is solid.

Since {{champion:110}}  has decent AP-Scalings and burst potential I wouldn't really recommend a {{item:3091}}. Rather buy boots.

So something I would try is like:
{{item:3006}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3135}} 
or
{{item:3020}}  {{item:3165}} {{item:3115}}{{item:3089}}  {{item:3085}} {{item:3135}} 
depending if you want to get your abilities off _faster_ or deal more a little bit more damage  in generall.

Since his ult got changed there is also maybe the option to built him FullBurst (Ult+Q) 
with something like
{{item:3020}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3135}} 
 or mix it, maybe change the Lich for a Nashors idk xD
Both AP-on-hit and full burst AP Varus are pretty fun. I personally prefer on-hit build, because it lets you melt people when your R is down. And I agree about Morello over Seraph's
Replace them with Rods, they don't stack, but Rods do.
Actually, the mana, which is the most important bit, does.
But you will be so squishy you get blown to bits.
Attempt this on {{champion:38}} or {{champion:13}} and enjoy your ability to forever spam every ability, even Kassadin's ultimate.

{{champion:82}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:51}} 

{{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3053}}  (Last item can be anything, but for most of these, a fifth sterak will work better than something else.)

It's recommended to bring at least 2-11% critical chance from runes.

The +25% base AD stat stacks on top of itself.
The UNIQUE shield passive **Does not stack**. However, the +25% will stack on top of all other +25%'s from every sterak's gage.
The trinity force does 200% of your increased total.
Example: You have two sterak's gages, so you have 62.25% increased base AD instead of 50%. Trinity force would get a 124.50% increase.

Characters who have an 'on basic hit' effect such as Caitlyn's effect from W or E do exceptionally well, and others who increase their next basic attack do just as well, or better.
Renekton W will cause you to do two to three total hits of this increased trinity force (but will exclude critical chance), and add a stun.
Mordekaiser Q if timed correctly to apply the effect on the third hit and you get lucky with a critical hit at full build, he will hit for over 6000 damage.

Additionally, this increased damage is applied to all things you use the spellblade on, including structures.

{{champion:17}} - {{item:3153}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3022}} 

You end up with about 4k health, a good mix of AP and AD, all the slows out the ass, and a good amount of damage. :P
One hundred ninety five percent ap in one auto.{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Your W passive damage will probably be very low because you don't have _any_ magic penetration.
I would consider buying sorcerer boots or getting a {{item:3135}}  or {{item:3151}}  instead of {{item:3116}} .
No, you need Rylais for Gnar if you do this poopy build. Just like you need Mallet on tank Gnar. you get laughed at if you dont build it. Slows on Gnar is just too good because no one can escape it.
But he has almost nothing to proc it over time :x
His Boomerang is a 2 second CD when you catch it max rank. Or swap it out for mallet.

Mallet would be the sane and therefore boring option. His boomerang slows also without rylais so you wouldn't even notive a difference.

EDIT:
I looked it up. At max Q Level Rylais is even weaker than the Q slow
Just in general for extra slows.

Hyper doesn't apply spell effects, so it wouldn't proc the slow.

All of Gnar's other abilities already have stronger CC.
or {{item:3091}} ??? {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

{{champion:72}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3009}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3147}} 

This may seem silly but i tried it a while ago and it works, its best to try in nexus siege or ascension however, when fighting in your spires you do stupid damage.

<_<

{{champion:103}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3035}} 

https://i.gyazo.com/9b421876c746dc7f5d513b7c28ebc8f2.png

Why do you have Rylai's Crystal Scepter? 

Hyper doesn't apply spell effects, so the only abilities Rylai's Crystal Scepter would apply on (that doesn't already have stronger CC) is Hop/Crunch (which have a stronger slow for half the duration) and an ultimate which misses the stun.
